column3: CIL-Civil Lot, DRL- Drainage Lot, EAL- Earthworks Lot, ELL- Electrical Lot, UTL- Utility Lot, STL- Structural Lot
EB - Eastbound, ME - Median, NB - Northbound, SB - Southbound, WB - Westbound

column2: Acceptance Criteria: Drainage pipes and culverts supplied in accordance with 701 and AS/NZS 4058.
Documentation as per 701.05 is available in Teambinder Material Approval form
Record of Conformity: Insert Teambinder Material Approval Number
Acceptance Criteria: Drainage Pits are supplied in accordance with 705.07.
Pits deeper than 1m to be fitted with step irons as shown on the drawings. Step irons to be compliant with AS4680.
Suppliers documentation has been submitted via Teambinder Material Approval form
Record of Conformity: Insert Teambinder Material Approval Number
Acceptance Criteria: Bedding Materials comply with Table 701.081 and 701.082.
Material Approved via Teambinder Material Approval Form.
Record of Conformity: Insert Teambinder Material Approval Number
Acceptance Criteria: Select and Ordinary Backfill Materials comply with tables 701.081 and 701.082
Material Approved via Teambinder Material Approval form.
Record of Conformity: Insert Teambinder Material Approval Number
Frequency: 1 per 1,000 tonnes or part thereof
Acceptance Criteria: Bedding and backfill material tested at to ensure materials comply with the following:
Reference Documents: Table 701.091, Table 701.092, Cl. 701.29, Table 701.291
Inspection / Test Method: Grading and Plasticity Index
Acceptance Criteria: Material inspection to be raised on ConQA for all precast pits, pipes and culverts.
Reference Documents: ConQA Order Acceptance Form
Record of Conformity: Insert ConQA Material Inspection Reference
Acceptance Criteria: All personnel on site have been briefed on the relevant work park to scope of works.
Record of Conformity: Work pack signed.
2.2 - Check that current revision drawings are being used
Acceptance Criteria: Issued For Construction (IFC) and latest available design revision in use.
Reference Documents: IFC Project Drawings/ Drawing Register
Record of Conformity: Latest revision IFC drawings
Acceptance Criteria: Current GPP signed and specific to the area where works will be executed. Including walk through of the work area with the site team and GPP Coordinator prior to works.
Inspection / Test Method: Document review & Site inspection
Acceptance Criteria: HDPE (Stormpro/Blackmax) pipes to be used only under non-paved areas inline with the latest design.
Inspection / Test Method: Teambinder Material Approval
Record of Conformity: Manufacturer certificate or accreditation
2.5 - Backfilling with cement stabilised sand (If required)

Acceptance Criteria: Subject to superintendent approval, underground stormwater drains may be backfilled to half the pipe diameter or box culvert height with 3% stabilised sand. Mixture to have a water content sufficient to ensure penetration beneath the pipe or box culvert invert without leaving free surface water.
Record of Conformity: Superintendents Correspondence, ITP signed
Frequency: Prior to commencing drainage line
Acceptance Criteria: Prior to commencement of excavation for the culverts and stormwater drainage, confirm the position with the Superintendent.
Reference Documents: VicRoads Spec. Cl. 701.10 IFC Drawing
Record of Conformity: Design and survey setout position confirmed with Superintendent.
Acceptance Criteria: Ensure trench is excavated to prepare culvert foundation and specified depth of bedding.
distance between culvert wall and trench wall is between 0.5 - 1.0 x the overall height of the culvert.

the width of trench at and below the level of the top of the pipe shall be such that the horizontal clearance from the outside of the pipe to the wall of the trench is greater than >300mm, less than <600mmm.
Clearance from external faces of the pit to each face of the excavation to be not less than 400mm
Reference Documents: VicRoads Spec. Cl. 701.15 Table 701.151 Cl. 705.05(b)
Inspection / Test Method: Site Inspection , Measurements of trench
Acceptance Criteria: Bedding material shall be provided and placed for the full width of the trench. The compacted thickness of bedding material following any shaping necessary shall be:
minimum 200mm for pipes with D ≥ 1500 mm
D' is the nominal pipe diameter or culvert width.
Bedding and backfill materials shall be placed and compacted in layers not exceeding 150 mm loose thickness.
Once culvert sections are in position, an additional layer of bedding material is placed to a height equal to 30% of the nominal pipe diameter or culvert height.
Bedding material which has a swell equal to or greater than 2.5% shall be maintained at a mean moisture ratio of 92% between the completion of rolling and the placement of the overlying layer.
Reference Documents: VicRoads Spec. Cl. 701.16 Cl. 701.20(a)
Acceptance Criteria: Rebate and socket ends of pipe sections are positioned facing upstream and are to be fully entered. (Laying from downstream)

The lower portion of the pipe shall be in contact with the bedding for the full length of each section. The compacted bedding shall be shaped to accommodate the joint collar and ensure that the pipe is supported along its full length.
Where applicable, the top of the pipe as marked shall be within five degrees of the vertical axis of the culvert.
Spacing of multiple rows of culverts to reflect Table 701.171.
Acceptance Criteria: Rebate and socket ends of pipe sections are positioned facing upstream and are to be fully entered. (Laying from downstream)
Consecutive sections of box culverts are firmly placed butted together. The top section matched to the bottom section and no lips over adjoining bottom sections.
Contact areas between the top and bottom sections mortared.
Multi‑row box culverts laid with sections in each row in contact with the sections in the adjacent rows.
Acceptance Criteria: Rebate and socket ends of pipe sections are positioned facing upstream and are to be fully entered. (Laying from downstream)
When cutting culvert section to length or to create a penetration, cuts to be done by machine to achieve a clean vertical face.
Any exposed reinforcement shall be coated with an approved epoxy treatment to prevent corrosion.
Inspection / Test Method: Document review/ Site Inspection
Record of Conformity: Manufacturer’s recommendations, ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: The location of each run of underground drainage has been verified by a survey pickup prior to backfill and form the as constructed survey.
RRJs assembled and prepared in accordance with the manufacturer’s recommendations.
(a) offset of entry pits required to match lines of kerbs or barriers +/-20mm
(b) plan location of pits other than offsets to kerb lines or barriers +/-100mm
(c) Invert leve of pipes at pits +/-50mm whilst maintaining required drainage grade.
(d) Departure from design grade of pipe runs +/-10mm in 10m provided minimum grade is not less than 1:250
Acceptance Criteria: Culvert Under Area to be Paved:

Where the trench has been excavated from design subgrade level or above, the trench is backfilled to design subgrade level with selected backfill material, and above that level with appropriate pavement material.
Where the trench is excavated from below design subgrade level the trench is filled with selected backfill material.
Culvert Under Area not to be Paved:
The trench is backfilled with selected backfill material to a level 300mm above the top of the culvert and with ordinary backfill material above that level.

Acceptance Criteria: Inlet and outlet structures constructed in accordance with the drawings and specification. Concrete used for the construction of inlet and outlet structures shall comply with the requirements of Section 610.

Where the trench has been excavated from design subgrade level or above, the trench is backfilled to design subgrade level with selected backfill material, and above that level with appropriate pavement material.
Footings extended to the depths shown on the drawings or as necessary to achieve a satisfactory foundation.
If backfilling to the required level, select backfill material is used.
Reference Documents: VicRoads Spec. Cl. 701.25 Cl.610
Inspection / Test Method: Document Review/ Site Inspection
Record of Conformity: Latest IFC Drawing ITP signed
Record of Conformity: Inspection Organisation, Inspection report, ITP signed
Frequency: 3 test per lot. , (1 lot consists of one layer of bedding for a culvert length between pits or endwalls) , Min. 20% of all lots for each culvert shall be tested.
Acceptance Criteria: Bedding assessed for compaction and /or moisture in lots.
Bedding compacted to refusal with handheld mechanical equipment with a mean moisture ratio of 92%.
Record of Conformity: Compaction and moisture Test Records , ITP signed
Frequency: 3 test per lot. , (1 lot consists of one layer of bedding for a culvert length between pits or endwalls) , Min. 20% of all lots for each culvert shall be tested.
Acceptance Criteria: Backfill assessed for compaction and or moisture in lots.
Backfill material which will have a nominal size after compaction of 40mm or < less compacted to a mean value of density ratio of not less than 97%.
Backfill material which has a swell equal to or greater > than 2.5% maintained at a mean moisture ratio of 92% between the completion of rolling and the placement of the overlying layer.
Record of Conformity: Compaction and moisture Test Records ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: Each culvert flushed clean from end to end on completion and maintained in proper working order.
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan's Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
Is the relevant RFI attached to the Lot?
Is the relevant NCR attached to the Lot?
Are any relevant Mails/ Transmittals attached to the Lot?
